doc.after: Giuga s conjecture says that this equation is also a sufficient condition for p to be prime Another consequence of Fermat s little theorem is the following if p is a prime number other than 2 and 5 1 p is always a recurring decimal whose period is p 1 or a divisor of p 1 The fraction 1 p expressed likewise in base q rather than base 10 has similar effect provided that p is not a prime factor of q Wilson s theorem says that an integer p 1 is prime if and only if the factorial p 1 1 is divisible by p Moreover an integer n 4 is composite if and only if n 1 is divisible by n
